review.title: One Decade of Universal Artificial Intelligence
review.abstract: The first decade of this century has seen the nascency of the first mathematical theory of general artificial intelligence. This theory of Universal Artificial Intelligence (UAI) has made significant contributions to many theoretical, philosophical, and practical AI questions. In a series of papers culminating in book (Hutter, 2005), an exciting sound and complete mathematical model for a super intelligent agent (AIXI) has been developed and rigorously analyzed. While nowadays most AI researchers avoid discussing intelligence, the award-winning PhD thesis (Legg, 2008) provided the philosophical embedding and investigated the UAI-based universal measure of rational intelligence, which is formal, objective and non-anthropocentric. Recently, effective approximations of AIXI have been derived and experimentally investigated in JAIR paper (Veness et al. 2011). This practical breakthrough has resulted in some impressive applications, finally muting earlier critique that UAI is only a theory. For the first time, without providing any domain knowledge, the same agent is able to self-adapt to a diverse range of interactive environments. For instance, AIXI is able to learn from scratch to play TicTacToe, Pacman, Kuhn Poker, and other games by trial and error, without even providing the rules of the games.

sections.text: ar Xiv: 120 2.61 53v1 [cs.AI] 2These achievements give new hope that the great goal of Artificial General Intelligence is not difficult to attain. This article provides an informal overview of UAI in context. It carefully attempts to introduce a very theoretical, formal and mathematical topic and discusses philosophical and technical ingredients, features of intelligence, some social issues as well as the past and future of UAI. "The formulation of a problem is often more important than its solution, which can only be a question of mathematical or experimental ability. To raise new questions, new ways of looking at old problems from a new perspective, requires creative imagination and marks a real advance in science." - Albert Einstein (1879-1955)

sections.heading: 1 Introduction
sections.text: It is as if people are able to understand the world, what they are doing to change the world and change it. It is as if they are able to change the world. sections.heading: 3 Universal Artificial Intelligence
sections.text: In this context, it is worth mentioning that this is a very complex issue.

sections.heading: 4 Facets of Intelligence
sections.text: I argue in this section that the AIXI model possesses all or at least most of the characteristics that an intelligent rational agent should possess. Some facets have already been formalized, some are essentially built in, but the majority must be XI XI XI XI. Some of the assertions have been proven in [Hut05], but the majority has yet to be addressed. Generalization is essentially an inductive inference [RH11] that deals with predicting future observations (often based on models of the learned world) from past observations. Solomonoff's theory of prediction [Sol64, Sol78] is a universally optimal solution to the prediction problem [Hut07, RH11]. Since it is a key term in the AIXI model, it is of course to expect that AIXI is an optimal predictor when predictors are rewarded for weak prediction problems.

sections.heading: 5 Social Questions
sections.text: Just think of the beginnings, as if they had been able to be in a position to be in a position to be in a position to be in a position to be in a position to be in a position to be in a position to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to move, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight, to fight.

sections.heading: 6 State of the Art
sections.text: This year, it has reached the stage where it will be able to take the lead.

sections.heading: 7 Discussion
sections.text: In this case, it is possible to examine philosophical concepts related to intelligence and to examine them mathematically. Formal definitions may not be perfect or unambiguously correspond to their intuitive counterparts, but in this case alternative formalizations are possible that allow a rigorous response to various social and ethical questions.

metadata.abstractText: The first decade of this century has seen the nascency of the first mathematical theory of general artificial intelligence. This theory of Universal Artificial Intelligence (UAI) has made significant contributions to many theoretical, philosophical, and practical AI questions.
